result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven S Aderhold was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing 01-01-2016 and each month thereafter or penalty of 12 days in jail, for non-payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Read In List filed by the District Attorney's office

Defendant Steven S Aderhold in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.   The Defendant was sentenced as follows: FINE: $399.00.  (to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing 1/1/16 or service 12 days jail consecutive as penalty for failure to pay. DNA SURCHARGE: $200.00. (to be paid as part of payment plan on fine.) Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Hearing at 11-30-2015 09:30 am
Defendant to have no contact with Walmart Store listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Steven S Aderhold in court, in custody.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 09:30 am.
